org.cougaar.core.component
Interface ServiceBroker

All Known Subinterfaces:
ExtendedServiceBroker
All Known Implementing Classes:
AddonServiceBroker, ContainedBinderSupport.ContainedServiceBroker, DelegatingServiceBroker, PluginSanityBinder.Enforcer.EnforcerServiceBroker, PropagatingServiceBroker, ServiceBrokerSupport, ServiceFilterBinder.FilteringServiceBroker
public interface ServiceBroker

Cougaar component Service Broker. Note that this was previously called Services in deference to the analogous BeanContextServices object.

Method Summary

getCurrentServiceClasses

java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Class<?>> getCurrentServiceClasses()
Gets the currently available services for this context. All standard implementations return an Iterator over a copy of the set of ServiceClasses so that there is no risk of ComodificationException.

getService

<T> T getService(java.lang.Object requestor,
                 java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass,
                 ServiceRevokedListener srl)
get an instance of the requested service from a service provider associated with this context. May return null (if no provider found) and various RuntimeExceptions may be thrown by the associated ServiceProvider. The ServiceBroker itself may throw ClassCastException if the ServiceProvider returns a non-null service object which is not an instance of the requested serviceClass.

Note that a successful call to getService almost always implies memory allocation, often not garbage-collectable, due to internal references.

releaseService

<T> void releaseService(java.lang.Object requestor,
                        java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass,
                        T service)
Release a service object previously requested by a call to getService. Service object instances usually require significant non-GCable memory, so must be released to reclaim the memory and/or the associated resources.
